SuChe

GET IN TOUCH

Year

2018

Location

Bangalore

Tags

User Experience, Conversational UI

Bumblebee

A global organisation, that is scaling at a great pace wanted their operations to be adaptable to the increasing number of employees. We imagined a world where they would have virtual personal assistant to do their menial jobs and also give them opportunity to self-serve.

Problem

The organisation has always been a people focussed one and weighed face to face interaction over anything that’s remotely different. There needed a paradigm shift of users’ behaviour and the UI is to survive even beyond the brutal hype cycle within the organisation.

Research

We started with understanding from the employees their needs, motivations and frustrations. We also analysed where they would spend most of their time and where they would need help from the operations team.

Analysis & Insight

From the analyses it was clear that the employees wanted to automate the jobs that they felt as non-productive and for others they wanted the control of doing the jobs themselves by means of self-service.

Character

We then started to create the character of the virtual assistant with the help of employees and also opened up the avenues for the employees to name their assistant.

Bumblebee came out to be the most voted name.

Responses

We then created the possible users’ intents and came up with the responses taking into consideration the tone of voice and character of the virtual assistant.

Role play

The dialogues were further improved by testing them to get the right tone of voice. Role play was used as the technique to bring in excitement and to make it more engaging.

Complex Interactions

Complex interactions were sketched and mocked up for easy understanding of the developers. The virtual assistant was added with more features developed iteratively after being user tested.

Wireframes
